H0.text: The gradient of bicoid protein determines the anterior‑posterior axis.

H1.text: Shallow posterior axis is determined by the gradient of bicoid protein.

H2.text: The gradient of bicoid protein determines the east–west axis.

H3.text: The vertical‑horizontal plane is determined by the gradient of bicoid protein.

A4.text: Bicoid protein gradient formation is one of the earliest steps in fruit fly embryo A‑P patterning.

A5.text: Bicoid protein represses the translation of caudal mRNA and enhances the transcription of anterior gap genes including hunchback, orthodenticle, and buttonhead.
